com.github.valid8j.pcond.forms

Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.valid8j.pcond.forms.Functions

  • public class Functions
extends Object

    An entry point for acquiring function objects. Functions retrieved by methods in this class are all "printable".

      • castTo

        public static <E> Function<? super Object,E> castTo(E value)

        Returns a function that casts an object into a given class.

            assertThat(
        asList(lastName, fullName),
        allOf(
            transform(elementAt(0).andThen(cast(String.class))).check(allOf(isNotNull(), not(isEmptyString()))),
            transform(elementAt(1).andThen(castTo((List<String>)value()))).check(Predicates.contains(lastName))));
 ```
        Type Parameters:
        E - The type to which the object is case.
        Parameters:
        value - A type place-holder. Always use a value returned from value() method.
        Returns:
        The function.

      • findString

        public static Function<String,String> findString(String substring)

        The returned function tries to find a substring after a given string. If found, it returns the result of the following statement.

        s.substring(s.indexOf(substring) + substring.length())

        If not found, a StringIndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        substring - A substring to find in a given string.
        Returns:
        The string after the substring.

        Returns:

      • call

        public static <T,R> Function<T,R> call(MethodQuery methodQuery)

        Returns a Function created from a method specified by a methodQuery. If the methodQuery matches none or more than one methods, a RuntimeException will be thrown.

        To pass an input value given to an entry point method, such as TestAssertions.assertThat, to the method, use a place-holder value returned by parameter().

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the input to the returned function
        Parameters:
        methodQuery - A query object that specifies a method to be invoked by the returned function.
        Returns:
        Created function.
        See Also:
        classMethod(Class, String, Object[]), instanceMethod(Object, String, Object[]), parameter()

      • classMethod

        public static MethodQuery classMethod(Class<?> targetClass,
                                      String methodName,
                                      Object... arguments)

        Creates a MethodQuery object from given arguments to search for static methods. Note that arguments are actual argument values, not the formal parameter types. The pcond library searches for the "best" matching method for you. In case no matching method is found or more than one methods are found, a RuntimeException will be thrown.

        In order to specify a parameter which should be passed to the returned function at applying, you can use an object returned by parameter() method. This is useful to construct a function from an existing method.

        To pass an input value given to an entry point method, such as TestAssertions.assertThat, to the method, use a place-holder value returned by parameter().

        That is, in order to create a function which computes sin using query a method Math.sin(double), you can do following

        public class Example
  public void buildSinFunction() {
    MethodQuery mq = classMethod(Math.class, "sin", parameter());
    Function<Double, Double> sin = call(mq);
    System.out.println(sin(Math.PI/2));
  }
}

        This prints 1.0.

        In case your arguments do not contain any Parameter object, the input argument passed to the built function will be simply ignored.

        Parameters:
        targetClass - A class
        methodName - A method name
        arguments - Arguments
        Returns:
        A method query for static methods specified by arguments.
        See Also:
        ReflUtils.findMethod(Class, String, Object[]), parameter()

      • instanceMethod

        public static MethodQuery instanceMethod(Object targetObject,
                                         String methodName,
                                         Object... arguments)

        Creates a MethodQuery object from given arguments to search for static methods. Excepting that this method returns a query for instance methods, it is quite similar to classMethod(Class, String, Object[]).

        This method is useful to build a function from an instance method. That is, you can create a function which returns the length of a given string from a method String.length() with a following code snippet.

        public void buildLengthFunction() {
  Function<String, Integer> length = call(instanceMethod(parameter(), "length"));
}

        In case the targetObject is not an instance of Parameter and arguments contain no Parameter object, the function will simply ignore the input passed to it.

        To pass an input value given to an entry point method, such as TestAssertions.assertThat, to the method, use a place-holder value returned by parameter().

        Parameters:
        targetObject - An object on which methods matching returned query should be invoked.
        methodName - A name of method.
        arguments - Arguments passed to the method.
        Returns:
        A method query for instance methods specified by arguments.
        See Also:
        classMethod(Class, String, Object[]), parameter()

      • call

        public static <T,R> Function<T,R> call(String methodName,
                                       Object... arguments)

        Returns a function that calls a method which matches the given methodName and args on the object given as input to it.

        Note that method look up is done when the predicate is applied. This means this method does not throw any exception by itself and in case you give wrong methodName or arguments, an exception will be thrown when the returned function is applied.

        public class Example {
  public void method() {
    assertThat(value, transform(call("toString")).check(isNotNull()));
  }
}

        To pass an input value given to an entry point method, such as TestAssertions.assertThat, to the method, use a place-holder value returned by parameter().

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of input to the returned function
        R - The type of output from the returned function
        Parameters:
        methodName - The method name
        arguments - Arguments passed to the method.
        Returns:
        A function that invokes the method matching the methodName and args
        See Also:
        parameter()

      • expectingException

        public static <T,E extends Throwable> Function<T,E> expectingException(Class<E> exceptionClass,
                                                                       Function<? super T,?> func)

        Returns a function that converts an input value to an exception object, which is thrown by func, when it is applied. If it does not throw an exception, or even if thrown, it is not an instance of exceptionClass, an assertion executed inside this method will fail and an exception to indicate it will be thrown. The exception will be typically an AssertionError.

        Type Parameters:
        T - A type of exception value to be thrown by func.
        E - An input value type of func.
        Parameters:
        exceptionClass - An exception class to be thrown.
        func - A function to be exercised
        Returns:
        A function that maps an input value to an exception.

      • parameter

        public static Parameter parameter()

        Returns a Parameter object, which is used in combination with instanceMethod(Object, String, Object[]), classMethod(Class, String, Object[]), or their shorthand methods. The object returned by this method is replaced with the actual input value passed to a function built through call(MethodQuery) or Predicates.callp(MethodQuery) when it is applied.

        Returns:
        a Parameter object
        See Also:
        classMethod(Class, String, Object[]), instanceMethod(Object, String, Object[]), call(MethodQuery), call(String, Object[]), Predicates.callp(MethodQuery), Predicates.callp(String, Object[])

      • value

        public static <E> E value()

        A method to return a value for a "casting placeholder value".

        Type Parameters:
        E - Type to cast to.
        Returns:
        Casting placeholder value
